article.headline: Penn State 94, Lock Haven 46
article.story: STATE COLLEGE, Pa. (AP) -- Aaron Johnson scored all 24 of his points in the paint and at the free-throw line as Penn State defeated Lock Haven 94-46 Friday night. It was the fourth straight win for the Nittany Lions (5-2), their longest winning streak in two seasons since winning five straight in the 2002-03 season. Penn State controlled every aspect of the game against the Bald Eagles (0-4), largely in part to Johnson, who shot 7-for-8 from the floor and 10-for-11 from the foul line. The Lions shot a season-high 64 percent (35-for-55) from the floor and a season-high 50 percent from 3-point range (8-for-16). Quentin Terry led Lock Haven with eight points. Geary Claxton and Danny Morrissey each scored 14 points for the Lions, who also got 11 points from Mike Walker and 10 points from Travis Parker. The Lions took a commanding 49-25 lead into halftime off the strength of 60 percent shooting (18-for-30), including five of 10 from 3-point range. Penn State finished the game on a 26-4 run in the final 12 minutes.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
